title: How to Make Creamy Mustard Deviled Eggs

steps.headline: Boil the eggs.
steps.description: Be sure to cover the pot with a lid and to remove the pot from the heat as soon as the water boils. The eggs should left in the hot water between 10 and 15 minutes.

steps.headline: Shock the eggs by running them under cold water, as this will stop the cooking process.
steps.description: Leave them in cold water for a few minutes until they are completely cooled.

steps.headline: Peel the eggs and cut them lengthwise in half.
Use a spoon to carefully scoop the yolks out from the whites.
Use the bottom of a fork to mash the yolks in a small bowl.
Measure and add the mustard, yogurt, and vinegar to the bowl.
steps.description: Thoroughly combine and mix everything together.

steps.headline: Create a plastic bag pipe.
steps.description: Add the egg yolk mixture to a small plastic zip bag. Cut off a small piece from the bottom corner and pipe it into the hard egg whites.

steps.headline: Garnish the deviled eggs with paprika.
Set in the refrigerator until ready to serve.

text: Boil the eggs. Be sure to cover the pot with a lid and to remove the pot from the heat as soon as the water boils. The eggs should left in the hot water between 10 and 15 minutes. Shock the eggs by running them under cold water, as this will stop the cooking process. Leave them in cold water for a few minutes until they are completely cooled. Peel the eggs and cut them lengthwise in half.  Use a spoon to carefully scoop the yolks out from the whites.  Use the bottom of a fork to mash the yolks in a small bowl.  Measure and add the mustard, yogurt, and vinegar to the bowl. Thoroughly combine and mix everything together. Create a plastic bag pipe. Add the egg yolk mixture to a small plastic zip bag. Cut off a small piece from the bottom corner and pipe it into the hard egg whites. Garnish the deviled eggs with paprika.  Set in the refrigerator until ready to serve.
